CMStyle Class Reference

Defines a style which is interoperable with CSS. More...

Inheritance diagram for CMStyle:

Public Member Functions

 __toString ()
 Return the string value of this object. This is the same as getCSS().
 CMStyle ($style= '')
 Create a new CMStyle object.
 getCSS ()
 Return this object as a validated CSS style attribute.

Data Fields

 $backgroundAttachment = false
 Specifies the attachment of the background image to the containing element. For example, if a background image is applied to a page normally the image will scroll with the rest of the page, but if the property is set to fixed then the image will stay in the same position as the user scrolls the page up and down.
 $backgroundColor = false
 Specifies the background color of a box.
 $backgroundImage = false
 Specifies the background image of a box.
 $backgroundPosition = false
 Specifies the position of a background image within its containing element. The value can be single, such as top or double such a top right.
 $backgroundRepeat = false
 Specifies how a background image will repeat itself within a box.
 $borderBottomColor = false
 Specifies the border color of a box.
 $borderBottomStyle = false
 Specifies the border style of a box.
 $borderBottomWidth = false
 Specifies the border width of a box.
 $borderCollapse = false
 Specifies which border model should be used in a table.
 $borderLeftColor = false
 Specifies the border color of a box.
 $borderLeftStyle = false
 Specifies the border style of a box.
 $borderLeftWidth = false
 Specifies the border width of a box.
 $borderRightColor = false
 Specifies the border color of a box.
 $borderRightStyle = false
 Specifies the border style of a box.
 $borderRightWidth = false
 Specifies the border width of a box.
 $borderSpacing = false
 Specifies the spacing between the borders of adjacent table cells in the "separated borders" model. Not supported by IE.
 $borderTopColor = false
 Specifies the border color of a box.
 $borderTopStyle = false
 Specifies the border style of a box.
 $borderTopWidth = false
 Specifies the border width of a box.
 $bottom = false
 For absolutely positioned boxes, specifies how far from the bottom of the containing box (which is the first containing relatively positioned box or the page itself) the box should be. For relatively positioned boxes, specifies how far from the bottom a box should be shifted.
 $captionSide = false
 Specifies on which side of the table a table-caption box (such as the default style of the HTML caption element) will be placed. Not supported by IE.
 $clear = false
 Specifies how box is placed after a floated box.
 $clip = false
 Specifies the area of an absolutely positioned box that should be visible.
 $color = false
 Specifies the foreground (text and border) colour in a box.
 $content = false
 Specifies generated content that can be displayed before or after an element. Used in conjunction with the :before and :after pseudo-elements. Not supported by IE.
 $counterIncrement = false
 Increments a named counter. Only supported by Opera at the time of writing.
 $counterReset = false
 Resets a named counter. Only supported by Opera at the time of writing.
 $cursor = false
 Specifies the appearance of the cursor when it passes over a box.
 $direction = false
 Specifies writing direction and the direction of embeddings and overrides (used in conjunction with unicode-bidi).
 $display = false
 Specifies the display type of a box.
 $emptyCells = false
 Applies to tables. Specifies whether empty table cells should be shown or not. Not recognized by Internet Explorer.
 $float = false
 Specifies whether a fixed-width box should float, shifting it to the right or left with surrounding content flowing around it.
 $fontFamily = false
 Specifies the font name of a box. This can be a comma-separated list, of which the browser will use the first font it recognizes. Font names that are made up of more than one word must be placed within quotation marks.
 $fontSize = false
 Specifies the size of a font in a box.
 $fontStyle = false
 Specifies whether the text in a box is italic or not.
 $fontVariant = false
 Specifies whether the lowercase letters in a box should be displayed in small uppercase.
 $fontWeight = false
 Specifies the boldness of a font. Browsers tend not to have any levels other than 400 (the same as normal), 700 (the same as bold) and 900.
 $height = false
 Specifies the height of a block box (not including padding, border or margin).
 $left = false
 For absolutely positioned boxes, specifies how far from the left of the containing box (which is the first containing relatively positioned box or the page itself) the box should be. For relatively positioned boxes, specifies how far from the left a box should be shifter.
 $letterSpacing = false
 Specifies the spacing in-between letters.
 $lineHeight = false
 Specifies the height of a line of text.
 $listStyleImage = false
 Specifies an image to be used as the list marker for a list item.
 $listStylePosition = false
 Specifies whether the list marker for a list item should appear inside or outside the list-item box.
 $listStyleType = false
 Specifies the style of the list marker bullet or numbering system within a list.
 $marginBottom = false
 Specifies the margin around a box.
 $marginLeft = false
 Specifies the margin around a box.
 $marginRight = false
 Specifies the margin around a box.
 $marginTop = false
 Specifies the margin around a box.
 $maxHeight = false
 Specifies the maximum height of a box. Not supported by IE.
 $maxWidth = false
 Specifies the maximum width of a box. Not supported by IE.
 $minHeight = false
 Specifies the minimum height of a box. Not supported by IE (where height acts the same).
 $minWidth = false
 Specifies the minimum width of a box. Not supported by IE.
 $orphans = false
 Used in paged media. Specifies the minimum number of lines in an element must be left at the bottom of a page.
 $outlineColor = false
 Specifies an outline for a box. Rendered around the outside of the border and on top of the box, so it does not affect its size or position. The value can combine outline-color, outline-style and outline-width. Not supported by IE/Win or Mozilla.
 $outlineStyle = false
 Specifies an outline for a box. Rendered around the outside of the border and on top of the box, so it does not affect its size or position. The value can combine outline-color, outline-style and outline-width. Not supported by IE/Win or Mozilla.
 $outlineWidth = false
 Specifies an outline for a box. Rendered around the outside of the border and on top of the box, so it does not affect its size or position. The value can combine outline-color, outline-style and outline-width. Not supported by IE/Win or Mozilla.
 $overflow = false
 Specifies what should happen to the overflow. The portions of content that do not fit inside a box.
 $paddingBottom = false
 Specifies the padding of a box.
 $paddingLeft = false
 Specifies the padding of a box.
 $paddingRight = false
 Specifies the padding of a box.
 $paddingTop = false
 Specifies the padding of a box.
 $pageBreakAfter = false
 Used in paged media. Specifies how a page break should be applied after a block box, forcing a new page box.
 $pageBreakBefore = false
 Used in paged media. Specifies how a page break should be applied before a block box, forcing a new page box.
 $pageBreakInside = false
 Used in paged media. Specifies how a page break should be applied inside a block box, forcing a new page box.
 $position = false
 Specifies how a box should be positioned.
 $quotes = false
 Specifies what form the quotes of the open-quote and close-quote values of the content property should take. Not supported by IE.
 $right = false
 For absolutely positioned boxes, specifies how far from the right of the containing box (which is the first containing relatively positioned box or the page itself) the box should be. For relatively positioned boxes, specifies how far from the right a box should be shifted.
 $tableLayout = false
 Specifies the algorithm that should be used to render a fixed-width table. Not supported by IE/Win 5.0.
 $textAlign = false
 Specifies the alignment of text inside a block box.
 $textDecoration = false
 Specifies whether text is underlined, over-lined or has a strikethrough.
 $textIndent = false
 Specifies the indentation of the first line of text in a block box.
 $textTransform = false
 Specifies the case of letters.
 $top = false
 For absolutely positioned boxes, specifies how far from the top of the containing box (which is the first containing relatively positioned box or the page itself) the box should be. For relatively positioned boxes, specifies how far from the top a box should be shifted.
 $unicodeBidi = false
 Used in conjunction with direction. Specifies how text is mapped to the Unicode algorithm, determining its directionality.
 $verticalAlign = false
 Specifies the vertical position of an inline box.
 $visibility = false
 Specifies whether a box is visible or not.
 $whiteSpace = false
 Specifies how the white space (such as new lines or a sequence of spaces) inside a box should be handled.
 $widows = false
 Used in paged media. Specifies the minimum number of lines in a box must be left at the top of a page.
 $width = false
 Specifies the width of a block box (not including padding, border or margin).
 $wordSpacing = false
 Specifies the spacing between words.
 $zIndex = false
 Specifies the order of relative or absolutely positioned boxes in the z-axis. The higher the number, the higher that box will be in the stack.

Detailed Description

Defines a style which is interoperable with CSS.

http://www.htmldog.com/reference/cssproperties

Author:
Elliot Chance

Definition at line 485 of file CMStyle.php.

Field Documentation

$height = false

Specifies the height of a block box (not including padding, border or margin).

Note:
IE will treat height similarly to min-height - content will push the height of a box higher if it does not fit in the specified height. Note: Internet Explorer 5.x will interpret the height as being inclusive of padding. Accommodating IE 5.x can be achieved by using the box model hack.

Definition at line 267 of file CMStyle.php.

$width = false

Specifies the width of a block box (not including padding, border or margin).

Note:
Internet Explorer 5.x will interpret the height as being inclusive of padding. Accommodating IE 5.x can be achieved by using the box model hack.
